docs.title: Build Your First AI App
docs.text:
So you finally decided to become an AI Engineer?

Perfect.

Today marks Day 1 of your journey, and trust me — if you follow this guide step-by-step, by the end of the day you will have built your first real AI application, the exact same way developers at top US startups do it.

No theory.

No fluff.

Just real development.

Let’s begin. 🔥

docs.title: ⭐ DAY 1 — Your AI Engineering Journey Begins
docs.text:
AI engineering is not about reading, it's about building. Today you will:

  • Set up your developer environment
  • Install your tools
  • Write your first API call
  • Build a reusable askAI() function
  • Run your own mini assistant

This is Level 0 → Level 1.

Let’s go.

docs.title: ✅ STEP 1 — Set Up Your Workspace (10 minutes)
docs.text: Before anything else, install these 3 things (if you haven't already):

docs.title: ✔ Git
docs.text:
These are industry-standard tools — the entire AI dev ecosystem runs smoothly with this trio.

Now, create your project folder:

mkdir -p ~/ai-roadmap/day1/
cd ~/ai-roadmap/day1/

Inside it, create a folder:

mkdir mini-assistant
cd mini-assistant
npm init -y
npm install openai dotenv

You just created your first AI project environment.

docs.title: ✅ STEP 2 — Get Your OpenAI API Key (5 minutes)
docs.text:
1. Go to the OpenAI Platform
  2. Open API Keys
  3. Generate a new key
  4. Copy it

Now create an .env file in your project:

OPENAI_API_KEY=your_key_here

Congrats — you’ve done what every professional AI engineer does on day one.

docs.title: ✅ STEP 3 — Your First API Call (20 minutes)
docs.text: Inside your project folder, create a new file:

docs.title: index.js
docs.text:
Paste this:

import OpenAI from "openai";
import dotenv from "dotenv";
dotenv.config();

const client = new OpenAI({ apiKey: process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY });

async function run() {
  const response = await client.chat.completions.create({
    model: "gpt-4o-mini",
    messages: [
      { role: "system", content: "You are scriptshady's personal AI guide." },
      {
        role: "user",
        content: "Tell me a short motivational line to start my AI journey.",
      },
    ],
  });

  console.log("AI Says:", response.choices[0].message.content);
}

run();

Run it:

node index.js

If your terminal prints a motivational message…

🎉 WELCOME — You just made your first AI call. You’re officially an AI developer now.

docs.title: ✅ STEP 4 — Build Your First Reusable AI Function (30 minutes)
docs.text:
This is how real AI products are built — reusable components.

Let’s build yours.

docs.title: Create assistant.js:
docs.text:
import OpenAI from "openai";
import dotenv from "dotenv";
dotenv.config();

const client = new OpenAI({ apiKey: process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY });

export async function askAI(message) {
  const res = await client.chat.completions.create({
    model: "gpt-4o-mini",
    messages: [
      { role: "system", content: "You are an intelligent helpful assistant." },
      { role: "user", content: message },
    ],
  });

  return res.choices[0].message.content;
}

docs.title: Now create test.js:
docs.text:
import { askAI } from "./assistant.js";

(async () => {
  const reply = await askAI("Explain embeddings in very simple words.");
  console.log("AI:", reply);
})();

Run it:

node test.js

If the reply prints → 🔥 You have officially built a modular AI engine.

This one concept alone is used in chatbots, RAG systems, assistants, developer tools, and AI startups.

docs.title: 🎯 DAY 1 COMPLETION CHECKLIST
docs.text:
If all of this is ✔️, you are done for the day:

  • Node project created
  • OpenAI package installed
  • API key working
  • First AI call executed
  • askAI() function coded
  • test.js returning responses
  • Confidence boosted

You just crossed:

docs.title: Level 0 → Level 1: From “Beginner” to “AI Builder”
docs.text:
Very few people even reach here.

But you did.

docs.title: 🚀 What’s Next? (Day 2 Teaser)
docs.text:
Tomorrow, you will:

  • Build your own prompt templates
  • Create persistent conversation memory
  • Learn how chat models think
  • Build your first mini tool

Things will start getting real.

If Day 1 felt powerful… Day 2 will feel like a superpower upgrade.
